intro: Androstephanos tarijensis, commonly known as the Tarija androstephanos, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Bolivia and Argentina. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in dry, sunny habitats and is often found in rocky or arid regions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
